ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable Logging of All FTP Transactions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: To trace malicious activity facilitated by the FTP service, it must be configured to ensure that all commands sent to the FTP server are logged using the verbose vsftpd log format.

ns0:criteria.comment: FTP is not being used or the conditions are met
FTP configuration conditions are not set or are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Create Warning Banners for All FTP Users
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: This setting will cause the system greeting banner to be used for FTP connections as well.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure System to Forward All Mail For The Root Account
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if root has the correct mail alias.

ns0:criteria.comment: Check if root has the correct mail alias.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if root has the correct mail alias.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure System to Forward All Mail From Postmaster to The Root Account
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if postmaster has the correct mail alias.

ns0:criteria.comment: Check if postmaster has the correct mail alias.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if postmaster has the correct mail alias.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Insecure File Locking is Not Allowed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Allowing insecure file locking could allow for sensitive data to be viewed or edited by an unauthorized user.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check for insecure NFS locks in /etc/exports

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable chrony daemon from acting as server
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Configure the port setting in /etc/chrony.conf to disable server operation.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable network management of chrony daemon
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Configure the cmdport setting in /etc/chrony.conf to disable chronyc management connections over network.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure Time Service Maxpoll Interval
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Configure the maxpoll setting in /etc/ntp.conf or chrony.conf to continuously poll the time source servers.

ns0:criterion.comment: check if no server entry is set in /etc/ntp.conf
check if maxpoll is set in /etc/ntp.conf
check if all server entries have maxpoll set in /etc/ntp.conf
check if no server or pool entry is set in /etc/chrony.conf
check if maxpoll is set in /etc/chrony.conf
check if all server entries have maxpoll set in /etc/chrony.conf

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Specify Additional Remote NTP Servers
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Multiple remote chronyd or ntpd NTP Servers for time synchronization should be specified (and dependencies are met)

ns0:criteria.comment: chronyd enabled and multiple remote servers specified
ntpd enabled and multile remote servers specified

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Specify a Remote NTP Server
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: A remote chronyd or ntpd NTP Server for time synchronization should be specified (and dependencies are met)

ns0:criteria.comment: chronyd enabled and remote server specified
ntpd enabled and remote server specified

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure that no other user than chrony is configured to run the chrony service

ns0:criteria.comment: chronyd enabled and multiple remote servers specified

ns0:criterion.comment: The default chrony user hasn't been overriden

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure Chrony has time sources configured with server directive

ns0:criteria.comment: chrony.conf only has server directive

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: A remote time server for Chrony is configured
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: A remote NTP Server for time synchronization should be specified (and dependencies are met)

ns0:criteria.comment: chrony.conf conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure server restrictions for ntpd
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Certain restrictions are imposed on ntp servers configured to be used by ntpd

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure ntpd is configured to run correctly under the ntp user.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Multiple ntpd NTP Servers for time synchronization should be specified.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: A remote ntpd NTP Server for time synchronization should be specified (and dependencies are met)

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable the NTP Daemon
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: At least one of the chronyd or ntpd services should be enabled if possible.

ns0:criteria.comment: chronyd or ntpd service enabled

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Remove Rsh Trust Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: There should not be any .rhosts or hosts.equiv files on the system.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Default SNMP Password Is Not Used
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SNMP default communities must be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SNMP version 1 and 2c must not be enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify Permissions on SSH Server Private *_key Key Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The system sshd key is owned by root:root and has the 0600 permission, or by a root:ssh_keys with the 0640 permission

ns0:criterion.comment: No keys that have unsafe ownership/permissions combination exist

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to Non-Root Local Partitions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nodev mount option prevents files from being interpreted as character or block devices. Legitimate character and block devices should exist in the /dev directory on the root partition or within chroot jails built for system services. All other locations should not allow character and block devices.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Bind Mount /var/tmp To /tmp

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Intrusion detection software or SELinux should be installed and enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install McAfee Virus Scanning Software
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: McAfee Antivirus software should be installed.

ns0:criteria.comment: Antivirus is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the McAfee Runtime Libraries and Linux Agent
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the McAfee Runtime Libraries (MFErt) and Linux Agent (MFEcma).

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the Asset Configuration Compliance Module (ACCM)
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the Asset Configuration Compliance Module (ACCM).

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the Policy Auditor (PA) Module
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the Policy Auditor (PA) Module.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable Dracut FIPS Module
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: fips module should be enabled in Dracut configuration

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable FIPS Mode
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if FIPS mode is enabled on the system

ns0:criterion.comment: check if system crypto policy selection in var_system_crypto_policy in the profile is set to FIPS

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure '/etc/system-fips' exists
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check /etc/system-fips exists

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set kernel parameter 'crypto.fips_enabled' to 1
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The kernel 'crypto.fips_enabled' parameter should be set to '1' in system runtime.

ns0:criterion.comment: kernel runtime parameter crypto.fips_enabled set to 1

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Build and Test AIDE Database
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The aide database must be initialized.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure AIDE to Verify the Audit Tools
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The Fedora operating system file integrity tool must be configured to protect the integrity of the audit tools.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure Periodic Execution of AIDE
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: By default, AIDE does not install itself for periodic execution. Periodically running AIDE is necessary to reveal unexpected changes in installed files.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify File Hashes with RPM
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Verify the RPM digests of system binaries using the RPM database.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify and Correct File Permissions with RPM
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Verify the permissions of installed packages by comparing the installed files with information about the files taken from the package metadata stored in the RPM database.

ns0:criterion.comment: mode of all files matches local rpm database

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Users Re-Authenticate for Privilege Escalation - sudo !authenticate
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks sudo usage without authentication

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Users Re-Authenticate for Privilege Escalation - sudo NOPASSWD
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks sudo usage without password

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Users Re-Authenticate for Privilege Escalation - sudo
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks sudo usage without password

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Only the VDSM User Can Use sudo NOPASSWD
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks sudo usage for the vdsm user without a password

ns0:criterion.comment: NOPASSWD only exists for vdsm user in /etc/sudoers
NOPASSWD only exists for vdsm user in /etc/sudoers.d

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure sudo only includes the default configuration directory
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if sudo includes only the default includedir

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Explicit arguments in sudo specifications
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check that sudoers doesn't contain commands without arguments specified

ns0:criterion.comment: Make sure that no commands are without arguments

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Don't define allowed commands in sudoers by means of exclusion
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check that sudoers doesn't contain command negations

ns0:criterion.comment: Make sure that no command in user spec contains negation

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Don't target root user in the sudoers file
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check that sudoers doesn't allow users to run commands as root

ns0:criterion.comment: Make sure that no user spec in sudoers has a runas spec that includes root or ALL
Make sure that all user specs in sudoers feature a runas spec

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure invoking users password for privilege escalation when using sudo
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure invoking user's password for privilege escalation when using sudo

ns0:criterion.comment: Check Defaults targetpw is not defined in /etc/sudoers file
Check Defaults rootpw is not defined in /etc/sudoers file
Check Defaults runaspw is not defined in /etc/sudoers file

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure dnf Removes Previous Package Versions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The clean_requirements_on_remove option should be used to ensure that old versions of software components are removed after updating.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure dnf-automatic to Install Available Updates Automatically
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure 'apply_updates' is configured with value 'yes in section 'commands' in /etc/dnf/automatic.conf

dnf-automatic is configured correctly

ns0:criterion.comment: test if configuration file /etc/dnf/automatic.conf exists for dnf-automatic_apply_updates

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Configure dnf-automatic to Install Only Security Updates
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure 'upgrade_type' is configured with value 'security in section 'commands' in /etc/dnf/automatic.conf

ns0:criteria.comment: dnf-automatic is configured correctly and configuration file exists
dnf-automatic is configured correctly

ns0:criterion.comment: test if configuration file /etc/dnf/automatic.conf exists for dnf-automatic_security_updates_only

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The Fedora release key package is required to be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The repo_gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of repository metadata always occurs.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure SELinux Not Disabled in the kernel arguments
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure selinux=0 argument is not present in the 'options' line of /boot/loader/entries/ostree-2-*.conf (or ostree-1-*.conf if there is no ostree-2-*.conf as ostree has only two enries at the most, with *-2-*.conf entry always being the most recent). Also, ensure that kernel is currently running with this argument by checking /proc/cmdline.

ns0:criterion.comment: Pass if there are no files matching pattern '/boot/loader/entries/ostree-2-.*.conf' exist in the system
Check if argument selinux=0 for Linux kernel is not present in /boot/loader/entries/ostree-1-.*.conf
Check if argument selinux=0 for Linux kernel is not present in /boot/loader/entries/ostree-2-.*.conf
Check if argument selinux=0 for Linux kernel is not present in /proc/cmdline

ns0:criteria.comment: dconf is configured correctly

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable the GNOME3 Screen Locking On Smartcard Removal
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure 'removal-action' is configured with value ''lock-screen' in section 'org/gnome/settings-daemon/peripherals/smartcard' in /etc/dconf/db/local.d/

ns0:criteria.comment: dconf is configured correctly

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable Auditing for Processes Which Start Prior to the Audit Daemon
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure audit=1 is configured in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if audit=1 is present in the boot parameters in the /boot/loader/entries/*.conf
check for audit=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX
check for audit=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Extend Audit Backlog Limit for the Audit Daemon
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Ensure audit_backlog_limit=8192 is configured in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if audit_backlog_limit=8192 is present in the boot parameters in the /boot/loader/entries/*.conf
check for audit_backlog_limit=8192 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX
check for audit_backlog_limit=8192 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT

check for iommu=force in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX
check for iommu=force in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure IPv6 is disabled through kernel boot parameter

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add nodev Option to Removable Media Partitions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The nodev option should be enabled for all removable devices mounts in /etc/fstab.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if removable partition really exists on the system
Check if removable partition value represents CD/DVD drive

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'nodev' mount option in /etc/fstab

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if CD/DVD drive is not configured to automount in /etc/fstab

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if removable partition is using 'nodev' mount option in /etc/fstab

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Add noexec Option to Removable Media Partitions
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The noexec option should be enabled for all removable devices mounts in /etc/fstab.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if removable partition really exists on the system
Check if removable partition value represents CD/DVD drive

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'noexec' mount option in /etc/fstab

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if CD/DVD drive is not configured to automount in /etc/fstab

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if removable partition is using 'noexec' mount option in /etc/fstab

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Check if CD/DVD drive is not configured to automount in /etc/fstab

ns0:criterion.comment: Check if removable partition is using 'nosuid' mount option in /etc/fstab
